org.jgrapes.io.util

Class ManagedBufferQueue<W extends ManagedBuffer<T>,T extends java.nio.Buffer>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jgrapes.io.util.ManagedBufferQueue<W,T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BufferCollector

    public class ManagedBufferQueue<W extends ManagedBuffer<T>,T extends java.nio.Buffer>
extends java.lang.Object
implements BufferCollector
    A queue based buffer pool.
    Author:
    Michael N. Lipp

public ManagedBufferQueue(java.lang.Class<W> wrapped,

        Create a pool that contains the (wrapped) buffers as initial content.

    • Method Detail

      • addBuffer

        public void addBuffer(T buffer)
        Wraps the given buffer as ManagedBuffer and adds it to the pool.
        Parameters:
        buffer - the buffer to add

      • acquire

        public W acquire()
          throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Acquires a managed buffer from the pool. If the pool is empty, waits for a buffer to become available. The buffer has a lock count of one.
        Returns:
        the acquired buffer
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted

      • recollect

        public void recollect(ManagedBuffer<?> buffer)
        Re-adds the buffer to the pool. The buffer is cleared.
        Specified by:
        recollect in interface BufferCollector
        Parameters:
        buffer - the buffer
        See Also:
        BufferCollector.recollect(org.jgrapes.io.util.ManagedBuffer)
